00141 #include <stdio.h>
00142 #ifdef M_WIMS_FOR_HCODE
00143 #include <Hcode/h_ccode.h>
00144 #endif
00145 #include <Lcode/l_main.h>

00148 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00149 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_VOID        0
00150 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT         1
00151 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_CHAR        8
00152 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_SHORT       16
00153 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_INT         16
00154 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_LONG        16
00155 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_LLONG       32
00156 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_FLOAT       -1
00157 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_DOUBLE      -1
00158 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_POINTER     ((M_model == M_WIMS_16) ? 16 : 32)
00159 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_UNION       -1
00160 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_STRUCT      -1
00161 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_BLOCK       -1
00162 #define M_WIMS_SIZE_MAX         ((M_model == M_WIMS_16) ? 16 : 32)
00163 
00164 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_VOID       -1
00165 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_BIT        1
00166 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR       8
00167 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_SHORT      16
00168 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_INT        16
00169 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_LONG       16
00170 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_LLONG      32
00171 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_FLOAT      -1 
00172 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_DOUBLE     -1
00173 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_POINTER    ((M_model == M_WIMS_16) ? 16 : 32)
00174 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_UNION      -1      /* depends on the field */
00175 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_STRUCT     -1
00176 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_BLOCK      -1
00177 #define M_WIMS_ALIGN_MAX        ((M_model == M_WIMS_16) ? 16 : 32)
00178 
00179 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00180 #define M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG            0       
00181 #define M_WIMS_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX         32
00182 #define MIN_PARAM_SIZE                  (32 * 0)
00183 
00184 /* incoming and outgoing parameters */
00185 #define M_WIMS_INT_BASE         0
00186 #define M_WIMS_FLT_BASE         0
00187 
00188 /* All return values are placed in P6, which is float/int */
00189 #define M_WIMS_RET_F              15       /* return in R0 */
00190 #define M_WIMS_RET_I32            15       /* return in R0 */
00191 #define M_WIMS_RET_I64            15       /* return in R0 */
00192 #define M_WIMS_RET_ST             15       /* return in R0 */

00196 /*
00197  *      The following functions are for documentation only.
00198  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00199  */
00200 void M_wims_void(M_Type type)
00201 {
00202     type->type = M_TYPE_VOID;
00203     type->unsign = 1;
00204     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_VOID;
00205     type->size = M_WIMS_SIZE_VOID;
00206     type->nbits = 0;
00207 }
00208 
00209 void M_wims_bit_long(M_Type type, int n)
00210 {
00211     type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00212     type->unsign = 1;
00213     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_BIT;
00214     type->size = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00215     type->nbits = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00216     M_assert ((n<=16), "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 16 bits");
00217 }
00218 
00219 void M_wims_bit_llong(M_Type type, int n)
00220 {
00221     type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG;
00222     type->unsign = 1;
00223     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_BIT;
00224     type->size = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00225     type->nbits = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00226     M_assert ((n<=16), "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 16 bits");
00227 }
00228 
00229 void M_wims_bit_int (M_Type type, int n)
00230 {
00231     type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_INT;
00232     type->unsign = 1;
00233     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_BIT;
00234     type->size = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00235     type->nbits = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00236     M_assert ((n <= 16), "M_bit_int: do not allow bit field of more than 16 bits");
00237 }
00238 
00239 void M_wims_bit_short(M_Type type, int n)
00240 {
00241     type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00242     type->unsign = 1;
00243     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_BIT;
00244     type->size = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00245     type->nbits = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00246     M_assert ((n<=16), "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 16 bits");
00247 }
00248 
00249 void M_wims_bit_char(M_Type type, int n)
00250 {
00251     type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR;
00252     type->unsign = 1;
00253     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_BIT;
00254     type->size = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00255     type->nbits = n * M_WIMS_SIZE_BIT;
00256     M_assert ((n<=8), "M_bit_char: do not allow bit field of more than 8 bits");
00257 }
00258 
00259 void M_wims_float(M_Type type, int unsign)
00260 {
00261     M_assert(0, "M_wims_float: float not supported in wims");
00262     type->type = M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00263     type->unsign = unsign;
00264     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00265     type->size = M_WIMS_SIZE_FLOAT;
00266     type->nbits = M_WIMS_SIZE_FLOAT;
00267 }
00268 
00269 void M_wims_double(M_Type type, int unsign)
00270 {
00271     M_assert(0, "M_wims_double: double not supported in wims");
00272     type->type = M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00273     type->unsign = unsign;
00274     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00275     type->size = M_WIMS_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00276     type->nbits = M_WIMS_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00277 }
00278 
00279 void M_wims_pointer(M_Type type)
00280 {
00281     type->type = M_TYPE_POINTER;
00282     type->unsign = 1;
00283     type->align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_POINTER;
00284     type->size = M_WIMS_SIZE_POINTER;
00285     type->nbits = M_WIMS_SIZE_POINTER;
00286 }
00287 
00288 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00289 int M_wims_eval_type(M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00290 {
00291   switch (type->type) {
00292   case M_TYPE_VOID:
00293     M_void(ntype);
00294     return(-1);                 /* can not be evaluated */
00295   case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00296   case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00297   case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00298   case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00299   case M_TYPE_INT:
00300   case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00301   case M_TYPE_LONG:
00302   case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00303     /* the starting address of array is used */
00304     M_int(ntype, type->unsign);
00305     return(M_TYPE_INT);
00306   case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00307   case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00308     M_wims_llong(ntype, type->unsign);
00309     return(M_TYPE_LLONG);
00310   case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00311     M_float(ntype, type->unsign);
00312     return(M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00313   case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00314     M_double(ntype, type->unsign);
00315     return(M_TYPE_DOUBLE);
00316   case M_TYPE_UNION:
00317   case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00318     *ntype = *type;
00319     return type->type;
00320   default:
00321     return(-1);
00322   }
00323 }
00324 
00325 int M_wims_eval_type2(M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00326 {
00327   switch (type->type) {
00328   case M_TYPE_VOID:
00329     M_void(ntype);
00330     return(-1);                 /* can not be evaluated */
00331   case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00332   case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00333     M_char(ntype, type->unsign);
00334     return(M_TYPE_CHAR);
00335   case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00336     M_short(ntype, type->unsign);
00337     return(M_TYPE_SHORT);
00338   case M_TYPE_BLOCK: 
00339   case M_TYPE_INT:
00340     /* the starting address of array is used */
00341     M_int(ntype, type->unsign);
00342     return(M_TYPE_INT);
00343   case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00344   case M_TYPE_LONG:
00345     M_long(ntype, type->unsign);
00346     return(M_TYPE_LONG);
00347   case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00348   case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00349     M_wims_llong(ntype, type->unsign);
00350     return(M_TYPE_LLONG);
00351   case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00352     M_pointer(ntype);
00353     return(M_TYPE_POINTER);
00354   case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00355     M_float(ntype, type->unsign);
00356     return(M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00357   case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00358     M_double(ntype, type->unsign);
00359     return(M_TYPE_DOUBLE);
00360   case M_TYPE_UNION:
00361   case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00362     *ntype = *type;
00363     return type->type;
00364   default:
00365     return(-1);
00366   }
00367 }
00368 
00369 int M_wims_call_type(M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00370 {
00371   switch (type->type) {
00372   case M_TYPE_VOID:
00373     M_void(ntype);
00374     return(-1);                 /* can not be evaluated */
00375   case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00376   case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00377   case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00378   case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00379   case M_TYPE_INT:
00380   case M_TYPE_LONG:
00381   case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00382   case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00383     /* the starting address of array is used */
00384     M_int(ntype, type->unsign);
00385     return(M_TYPE_INT);
00386   case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00387   case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00388     M_wims_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00389     return (M_TYPE_LLONG);
00390   case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00391 #if 0
00392     /* commented out, because passing floats doesn't appear to work with
00393        library functions such as printf, although nowhere does it say that
00394        I have to use doubles                                            */
00395     M_float(ntype, type->unsign);
00396     return(M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00397 #endif
00398     /* BCC - 8/5/96
00399      * Pcode has inserted all the necessary castings. So don't insert
00400      * promotions here
00401      */
00402     M_float(ntype, type->unsign);
00403     return(M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00404   case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00405     M_double(ntype, type->unsign);
00406     return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00407   case M_TYPE_UNION:
00408   case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00409     *ntype = *type;
00410     return(type->type);
00411   default:
00412     return(-1);
00413   }
00414 }
00415 
00416 int M_wims_call_type2(M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00417 {
00418   switch (type->type) {
00419   case M_TYPE_VOID:
00420     M_void(ntype);
00421     return(-1);                 /* can not be evaluated */
00422   case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00423   case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00424   case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00425   case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00426   case M_TYPE_INT:
00427   case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00428   case M_TYPE_LONG:
00429     M_int(ntype, type->unsign);
00430     return(M_TYPE_INT);
00431   case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00432   case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00433     M_wims_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00434     return (M_TYPE_LLONG);
00435   case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00436     M_pointer(ntype);
00437     return(M_TYPE_POINTER);
00438   case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00439 #if 0
00440     /* commented out, because passing floats doesn't appear to work with
00441        library functions such as printf, although nowhere does it say that
00442        I have to use doubles                                            */

00444     return(M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00445 #endif
00446     /* BCC - 8/5/96
00447      * Pcode has inserted all the necessary castings. So don't insert
00448      * promotions here
00449      */
00450     M_float(ntype, type->unsign);
00451     return(M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00452   case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00453     M_double(ntype, type->unsign);
00454     return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00455   case M_TYPE_UNION:
00456   case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00457     *ntype = *type;
00458     return(type->type);
00459   default:
00460     return(-1);
00461   }
00462 }

00515 
00516 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00517 void M_wims_array_layout(M_Type type, int *offset)
00518 {
00519     *offset = 0;                        /* assume first element is aligned */
00520 }
00521 
00522 int M_wims_array_align(M_Type type)
00523 {
00524     return type->align;
00525 }
00526 
00527 int M_wims_array_size(M_Type type, int dim)
00528 {
00529     int mod, size, align;
00530 
00531     size = type->size;
00532     align = type->align;
00533     mod = size % align;
00534     if ( mod!=0 )
00535         size += (align - mod);
00536 
00537     return (size * dim);
00538 }
00539 
00540 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00541 void M_wims_union_layout(int n, _M_Type *type, int *offset, int *bit_offset)
00542 {
00543     int i;
00544     for ( i=0; i<n; i++ ) {                     /* assume the union is aligned */
00545         offset[i] = 0;
00546         bit_offset[i] = 0;
00547     }
00548 }
00549 
00550 int M_wims_union_align(int n, _M_Type *type)
00551 {
00552     int i, max;
00553     max = 0;
00554     for ( i=0; i<n; i++ ) {
00555         int aln = type[i].align;
00556         if (aln > max)
00557             max = aln;
00558     }
00559     /*
00560      *  align to at least byte boundary.
00561      */
00562     if ( max < M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR )
00563         max = M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR;
00564 
00565     return max;
00566 }
00567 
00568 int M_wims_union_size(int n, _M_Type *type)
00569 {
00570     int i, aln, max_size, max_align;
00571 
00572     max_size = 0;
00573     max_align = 0;
00574     for ( i=0; i < n; i++ ) {
00575         int size;
00576         size = type[i].size;
00577         if (size > max_size) 
00578             max_size = size;
00579         aln = type[i].align;
00580         if (aln > max_align) 
00581             max_align = aln;
00582     }
00583     /*
00584      *  align to at least byte boundary.
00585      */
00586     if ( max_align < M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR )
00587         max_align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR;
00588 
00589     /* need to increment to the max. align for future array extension */
00590     i = max_size % max_align;
00591     if ( i != 0 )
00592         max_size += (max_align - i);
00593         
00594     return max_size;
00595 }
00596 
00597 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00598 /* NOTE: the bit_offset array is never used by Hcode, so I ignore it.       */
00599 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00600 void M_wims_struct_layout(int n, _M_Type *type, int *base, int *bit_offset)
00601 {
00602     int i, offset;
00603     int mod, size, align, mod_word,mod_type;
00604 
00605     offset = 0;                         /* assume initially aligned */
00606     for ( i=0; i<n ; i++ ) {
00607         size = type[i].size;
00608         align = type[i].align;
00609         M_assert((size!=0) && (align!=0),
00610                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00611         /*
00612          *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00613          *  keep them in a word when possible.
00614          */
00615         mod_word = offset % M_WIMS_SIZE_INT;
00616         if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR ) {
00617             if ( (mod_word + size) > M_WIMS_SIZE_INT )
00618                 offset += (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00619             else {
00620                 mod_type = offset % M_WIMS_SIZE_CHAR;
00621                 if ( (mod_type + size) > M_WIMS_SIZE_CHAR ) {
00622                 /* fprintf(stdout,"Changing bit char to bit short\n"); */
00623                     type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00624                 }
00625             }
00626         }
00627         if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT )  {
00628             if ( (mod_word + size) > M_WIMS_SIZE_INT )
00629                 offset += (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00630             else {
00631                 mod_type = offset % M_WIMS_SIZE_SHORT;
00632                 if ( (mod_type + size) > M_WIMS_SIZE_SHORT ) {
00633                 /* fprintf(stdout,"Changing bit short to bit long\n"); */
00634                     type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00635                 }
00636             }
00637         }
00638         else if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG )  {
00639             if ( (mod_word + size) > M_WIMS_SIZE_INT )
00640                 offset += (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00641         }
00642 
00643         mod = offset % align;           /* align to what the field */
00644         if ( mod!=0 )                           /* needs to start from */
00645              offset += (align - mod);
00646 
00647         if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR )  {
00648             int mod = offset % M_WIMS_SIZE_INT;
00649 
00650             bit_offset[i] = offset - mod + (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00651             base[i] =   offset & (~(M_WIMS_SIZE_CHAR-1));
00652 #if 0
00653 fprintf(stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n", type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00654 #endif
00655         }
00656         else if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT )  {
00657             int mod = offset % M_WIMS_SIZE_INT;
00658 
00659             bit_offset[i] = offset - mod + (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00660             base[i] =   offset & (~(M_WIMS_SIZE_SHORT-1));
00661 #if 0
00662 fprintf(stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n", type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00663 #endif
00664         }
00665         else if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG )  {
00666             int mod = offset % M_WIMS_SIZE_INT;
00667 
00668             bit_offset[i] = offset - mod + (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00669             base[i] =   offset & (~(M_WIMS_SIZE_LONG-1));
00670 #if 0
00671 fprintf(stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n", type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00672 #endif
00673         }
00674         else { 
00675             base[i] = offset;
00676             bit_offset[i] = 0;
00677 #if 0
00678 fprintf(stderr, "type = %d, base = %d, bit_offset = %d\n", type[i].type, base[i], bit_offset[i]);
00679 #endif
00680 
00681         }
00682 
00683         offset += size;                 /* allocate space */
00684     }
00685 }
00686 
00687 int M_wims_struct_align(int n, _M_Type *type)
00688 {
00689     int i, max;
00690     max = 0;
00691     for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
00692         int aln = type[i].align;
00693         if (aln > max) max = aln;
00694     }
00695     /*
00696      *  align to at least byte boundary.
00697      */
00698     if (max<M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR)
00699         max = M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR;
00700     return max;
00701 }
00702 
00703 int M_wims_struct_size(int n, _M_Type *type, int struct_align)
00704 {
00705     int i, offset;
00706     int mod, size, align, max_align, mod_word;
00707     offset = 0;                         /* assume initially aligned */
00708     max_align = struct_align;
00709     for ( i=0; i<n; i++ ) {
00710         size = type[i].size;
00711         align = type[i].align;
00712         M_assert((size!=0) && (align!=0),
00713                         "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00714         if (align > max_align)
00715             max_align = align;
00716         /*
00717          *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00718          *  keep them in a word when possible.
00719          */
00720         mod_word = offset % M_WIMS_SIZE_INT;
00721         if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR ) {
00722             if ( (mod_word + size) > M_WIMS_SIZE_INT )
00723                 offset += (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00724             if ( M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR > max_align )
00725                 max_align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR;
00726         }
00727         else if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT )  {
00728             if ( (mod_word + size) > M_WIMS_SIZE_INT )
00729                 offset += (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00730             if ( M_WIMS_ALIGN_SHORT > max_align )
00731                 max_align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_SHORT;
00732         }
00733         else if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG )  {
00734             if ( (mod_word + size) > M_WIMS_SIZE_INT )
00735                 offset += (M_WIMS_SIZE_INT - mod_word);
00736             if ( M_WIMS_ALIGN_LONG > max_align )
00737                 max_align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_LONG;
00738         }
00739         mod = offset % align;           /* align to what the field */
00740         if ( mod!=0 )                           /* needs to start from */
00741              offset += (align - mod);
00742 
00743         offset += size;
00744     }
00745      /*
00746       * align to at least byte boundary.
00747       */
00748     if ( max_align<M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR )
00749         max_align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_CHAR;
00750     /* enforce max. alignment */
00751     mod = offset % max_align;
00752     if (mod!=0)
00753         offset += (max_align - mod);
00754     return offset;
00755 }
00756 
00757 int
00758 M_wims_layout_fnvar (List param_list, char **base_macro,
00759                      int *pcount, int purpose)
00760 {
00761   M_Param param;
00762 
00763   int max_align, off;
00764   int int_rg;
00765   int fp_rg;
00766   int size, align, mod, tp;
00767 
00768   switch (purpose)
00769     {
00770         case M_GET_FNVAR:
00771           *base_macro = "$IP";
00772           break;
00773         case M_PUT_FNVAR:
00774           *base_macro = "$OP";
00775           break;
00776         case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
00777         default:
00778           M_assert (0, "M_wims_layout_fnvar: unknown purpose");
00779     }
00780 
00781   max_align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_INT;
00782   fp_rg = 0;
00783   int_rg = 0;
00784   off = M_WIMS_SIZE_INT;
00785 
00786   List_start (param_list);
00787   while ((param = (M_Param)List_next (param_list)))
00788     {
00789       tp = param->mtype.type;
00790 
00791       switch (tp)
00792         {
00793           case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00794           case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00795           case M_TYPE_INT:
00796           case M_TYPE_LONG:
00797           case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00798             if (int_rg < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00799               {
00800                 param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00801                 param->reg = (int_rg)++ + M_WIMS_INT_BASE;
00802               }
00803             else
00804               {
00805                 param->mode = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00806                 param->reg = -1;
00807               }
00808             break;
00809 
00810          case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00811            if(int_rg + 1 < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG) {
00812              param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00813              param->reg = (int_rg) + M_WIMS_INT_BASE;
00814              int_rg += 2;
00815            }
00816            else {
00817              param->mode = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00818              param->reg = -1;
00819              if(int_rg < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00820                int_rg++;
00821            }
00822            break;
00823 
00824           case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00825             M_assert(0, "M_wims_layout_fnvar: float params not allowed");
00826             if (int_rg < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00827               {
00828                 param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00829                 param->reg = (fp_rg) + 1 + M_WIMS_FLT_BASE;
00830                 int_rg += 1;
00831                 fp_rg  += 1;
00832               }
00833             else
00834               {
00835                 param->mode = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00836                 param->reg = -1;
00837               }
00838             break;
00839 
00840           case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00841             M_assert(0, "M_wims_layout_fnvar: float params not allowed");
00842             if (int_rg < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00843               {
00844                 param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00845                 param->reg = fp_rg + 1 + M_WIMS_FLT_BASE;
00846                 int_rg += 2;
00847                 fp_rg  += 1;
00848               }
00849             else
00850               {
00851                 param->mode = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00852                 param->reg = -1;
00853               }
00854             break;
00855 
00856           case M_TYPE_UNION:
00857           case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00858             size = param->mtype.size;
00859             param->mode = M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY;
00860             param->reg = 0;
00861             break;
00862           default:
00863             M_assert (0, "M_wims_layout_fnvar: argument is not promoted");
00864         }
00865       /* note, the method of calculating offsets may seem strange, but */
00866       /* the WIMS convention has the stack growing towards high memory   */
00867       /* and the parameters are referenced back from the $sp, with the */
00868       /* first parameter being closest to the stack pointer            */
00869       size = param->mtype.size;
00870       align = param->mtype.align;
00871 
00872       if (param->mtype.type == M_TYPE_UNION ||
00873           param->mtype.type == M_TYPE_STRUCT)
00874         {
00875           /* make sure correct size and alignment is used for
00876            * struct/union passed indirectly thru registers
00877            * if IMPACT allowed structures to be passed via registers,
00878            * this would not have to be done
00879            */
00880           if (param->mode == M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER)
00881             {
00882               size = M_WIMS_SIZE_POINTER;
00883               align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_POINTER;
00884             }
00885         }
00886       if (align >= M_WIMS_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX &&
00887           param->mtype.type != M_TYPE_DOUBLE)
00888         /* anything larger than a 64-bit structure is passed */
00889         /* indirectly thru memory                            */
00890         align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_POINTER;
00891       else if (align < M_WIMS_ALIGN_INT)
00892         /* anything smaller that 32-bits is passed as 32-bits */
00893         align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_INT;
00894 
00895       mod = off % align;
00896 
00897       /* place the offset pointer to the boundary of the appropriate */
00898       /* data size                                                   */
00899       if (mod != 0)
00900         off += (align - mod);
00901 
00902       // high to low, with positive offsets
00903       param->offset = off;
00904       off += size;
00905 
00906       // high to low, with positive offsets
00907       // off += size;
00908       // param->offset = -off;
00909     }
00910   /* The param section must be at least certain size.
00911    * This is the backing store for the parameter regs. */
00912   if (off < MIN_PARAM_SIZE)
00913     off = MIN_PARAM_SIZE;
00914 
00915   /* now for the body of the structures... small ones first. */
00916 
00917   List_start (param_list);
00918   while ((param = (M_Param)List_next (param_list)))
00919     {
00920       tp = param->mtype.type;
00921       size = param->mtype.size;
00922 
00923       if (((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
00924           (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) &&
00925           (size <= M_WIMS_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX))
00926         {
00927           /* must align to a double boundry */
00928           align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_MAX;
00929 
00930           mod = off % align;
00931 
00932           if (mod != 0)
00933             off += (align - mod);
00934 
00935           param->paddr = off;
00936           off += size;
00937         }
00938     }
00939 
00940   /* now large ones */
00941   List_start (param_list);
00942   while ((param = (M_Param)List_next (param_list)))
00943     {
00944       tp = param->mtype.type;
00945 
00946       size = param->mtype.size;
00947 
00948       if (((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
00949           (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) &&
00950           (size > M_WIMS_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX))
00951         {
00952 
00953           /* must align to a double boundry */
00954           align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_MAX;
00955 
00956           mod = off % align;
00957 
00958           if (mod != 0)
00959             off += (align - mod);
00960          
00961           param->paddr = off;
00962           off += size;
00963         }
00964     }
00965 
00966   *pcount = int_rg;
00967   return off;               /* the total size needed */
00968 }
00969 
00970 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00971 int M_wims_fnvar_layout(int n, _M_Type *type, long int *offset, int *mode,
00972                         int *reg, int *paddr, char **macro, 
00973                         int *su_sreg, int *su_ereg,
00974                         int *pcount, int is_st, int purpose)
00975                   
00976                                         /* need to return structure */
00977                  
00978 {
00979     int i, max_align, off=0, rg;
00980     int size, align, mod, tp;
00981 
00982 
00983     switch (purpose) {
00984         case M_GET_FNVAR: 
00985             *macro = "$IP"; 
00986             break;
00987         case M_PUT_FNVAR: 
00988             *macro = "$OP";
00989             break;
00990         case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
00991         default:            
00992             M_assert(0, "M_fnvar_layout: unknown purpose");
00993     }
00994 
00995     // return value
00996     off = M_WIMS_SIZE_INT;
00997 
00998     max_align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_INT;
00999     rg = 0;
01000 
01001     for ( i = 0; i < n; i++ ) {
01002         tp = type[i].type;
01003         switch (tp) {
01004             case M_TYPE_CHAR:
01005             case M_TYPE_SHORT:
01006             case M_TYPE_INT:
01007             case M_TYPE_LONG:
01008             case M_TYPE_POINTER:
01009                 if (rg < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG) {
01010                     mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01011                     reg[i] = (rg)++ + M_WIMS_INT_BASE;
01012                 }
01013                 else  {
01014                     mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01015                     reg[i] = -1;
01016                 }
01017                 break;
01018 
01019            case M_TYPE_LLONG:
01020               if(rg + 1 < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG) {
01021                 mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01022                 reg[i] = (rg) + M_WIMS_INT_BASE;
01023                 rg += 2;
01024               }
01025               else {
01026                 mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01027                 reg[i] = -1;
01028                 if(rg < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
01029                   rg++;
01030               }
01031               break;
01032 
01033             case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01034                 M_assert(0, "M_wims_fnvar_layout: float params not allowed");
01035                 if ( rg < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG )  {
01036                     mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01037                     reg[i] = (rg)++ + M_WIMS_FLT_BASE;
01038                 }
01039                 else  {
01040                     mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01041                     reg[i] = -1;
01042                 }
01043                 break;
01044 
01045             case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01046                 M_assert(0, "M_wims_fnvar_layout: double params not allowed");
01047                 if ( rg < M_WIMS_MAX_FNVAR_REG )  { 
01048                     if ( rg == 0 || rg == 2 )  {
01049                         mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01050                         reg[i] = rg + 1 + M_WIMS_FLT_BASE;
01051                         rg += 2;
01052                     }
01053                     else if ( rg == 1 ) {
01054                         mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01055                         reg[i] = 3 + M_WIMS_FLT_BASE;
01056                         rg += 3;
01057                     }
01058                     else {
01059                         mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01060                         reg[i] = -1;
01061                     }   
01062                 } 
01063                 else {
01064                     mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01065                     reg[i] = -1;
01066                 }
01067                 break;
01068 
01069             case M_TYPE_UNION:
01070             case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
01071                 size = type[i].size;
01072                 mode[i] = M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY;
01073                 reg[i] = 0;
01074                 break;
01075 
01076             default:
01077                 M_assert(0, "M_fnvar_layout: argument is not promoted");
01078         }
01079 
01080         /* note, the method of calculating offsets may seem strange, but */
01081         /* the WIMS convention has the stack growing towards high memory   */
01082         /* and the parameters are referenced back from the $sp, with the */
01083         /* first parameter being closest to the stack pointer            */
01084         size = type[i].size;
01085         align = type[i].align;
01086 
01087         if ( type[i].type == M_TYPE_UNION ||
01088              type[i].type == M_TYPE_STRUCT ) {
01089         /* make sure correct size and alignment is used for struct/union */
01090         /* passed indirectly thru registers                              */
01091         /* if IMPACT allowed structures to be passed via registers, this */
01092         /* would not have to be done                                     */
01093             if ( mode[i] == M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER )  {
01094                 size = M_WIMS_SIZE_POINTER;
01095                 align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_POINTER;
01096             }   
01097         }
01098         if ( align >= M_WIMS_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX && type[i].type != M_TYPE_DOUBLE ) 
01099             /* anything larger than a 64-bit structure is passed */
01100             /* indirectly thru memory                            */
01101             align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_POINTER; 
01102         else if ( align < M_WIMS_ALIGN_INT )
01103             /* anything smaller that 16-bits is passed as 16-bits */
01104             align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_INT;
01105 
01106         mod = off % align;
01107 
01108         /* place the offset pointer to the boundary of the appropriate */
01109         /* data size                                                   */
01110         if ( mod != 0 ) 
01111             off += (align - mod);
01112 
01113         /* now increment the offset to point to the actual location    */
01114         /* for this parameter                                          */
01115 
01116         // for high to low, with positive offsets
01117         offset[i] = off;
01118         off += size; 
01119     }
01120 
01121     /* The param section must be at least certain size.
01122      * This is the backing store for the parameter regs. */
01123     if ( off < MIN_PARAM_SIZE )
01124         off = MIN_PARAM_SIZE;
01125 
01126     /* now for the body of the structures... small ones first. */
01127     for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
01128         tp = type[i].type;
01129 
01130         size = type[i].size;
01131 
01132         if ( ((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
01133               (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) &&
01134               (size <= M_WIMS_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX) ) {
01135 
01136             align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_MAX;   /* must align to a double boundry */
01137 
01138             mod = off % align;
01139 
01140             if ( mod!=0 )
01141                 off += (align - mod);
01142 
01143             paddr[i] = off;
01144             off += size;
01145         }
01146     }
01147 
01148     /* now large ones */
01149     for (i=0; i<n; i++) {
01150         tp = type[i].type;
01151 
01152         size = type[i].size;
01153 
01154         if ( ((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
01155               (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) &&
01156               (size > M_WIMS_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX) ) {
01157 
01158             align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_MAX;   /* must align to a double boundry */
01159 
01160             mod = off % align;
01161 
01162             if ( mod!=0 ) 
01163                 off += (align - mod);
01164 
01165             paddr[i] = off;
01166             off += size;
01167         }
01168     }
01169 
01170     return off;   /* the total size needed */
01171 }
01172 
01173 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01174 int M_wims_lvar_layout(int n, _M_Type *type, long int *offset, char **base_macro)
01175 {
01176     int i, max_align, off;
01177     int size, align, mod, tp;
01178     /*
01179      *  the LOCAL section must be max. aligned initially
01180      */
01181     max_align = M_WIMS_ALIGN_MAX;
01182     off = 0;
01183     for ( i = 0; i < n; i++ ) {
01184         tp = type[i].type;
01185         if (tp==M_TYPE_BIT_LONG) {
01186             M_assert(0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
01187         }
01188         if (tp==M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR) {
01189             M_assert(0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
01190         }
01191         size = type[i].size;
01192         align = type[i].align;
01193         mod = off % align;
01194         if ( mod != 0 )
01195             off += (align - mod);
01196 
01197         // high to low, with positive offsets
01198         offset[i] = off;
01199         off += size;
01200     }
01201     
01202     /* the local section must be max. aligned */
01203     mod = off % max_align;
01204     if ( mod != 0 )
01205         off += (max_align - mod);
01206     /*
01207      *  Local variables are relative to $LV
01208      */
01209     *base_macro = "$LV";
01210      return off;                                /* the total size needed */
01211 }
01212 
01213 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01214 int M_wims_no_short_int(void) {
01215     return (M_WIMS_SIZE_SHORT == M_WIMS_SIZE_INT);
01216 }
01217 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01218 void M_wims_cb_label_name(char *fn, int cb, char *line, int len)
01219 {
01220     sprintf(line, "cb%d%s", cb, fn);
01221 }
01222 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01223 int M_wims_is_cb_label(char *label, char *fn, int *cb)
01224 {
01225     return (sscanf(label, "cb%d%s", cb, fn)==2);
01226 }
01227 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01228 void M_wims_jumptbl_label_name(char *fn, int tbl_id, char *line, int len)
01229 {
01230     sprintf(line, "_$%s%s%d", fn, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, tbl_id);
01231 }
01232 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01233 /* Format for wims is: _$%sM_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME%d, where %s is the func name */
01234 int M_wims_is_jumptbl_label(char *label, char *fn, int *tbl_id)
01235 {
01236     char *ptr;
01237     int label_len, fn_len, base_len;
01238 
01239     /* Check the prefix */
01240     if (strncmp(label, "_$", 2))
01241         return (0);
01242 
01243     /* Some length checks, to make sure we dont step outside array */
01244     label_len = strlen(label);
01245     fn_len = strlen(fn);
01246     base_len = strlen(M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME);
01247     if (label_len <= (2+fn_len+base_len))
01248         return (0);
01249 
01250     /* Check that fn is correct */
01251     ptr = label;
01252     ptr += 2;
01253     if (strncmp(ptr, fn, fn_len))
01254         return (0);
01255 
01256     /* Check that jumptbl base name is correct */
01257     ptr += fn_len;
01258     if (strncmp(ptr, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, base_len))
01259         return (0);
01260 
01261     /* Get the id */
01262     ptr += base_len;
01263     return (sscanf(ptr, "%d", tbl_id)==1);
01264 }
01265 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01266 int M_wims_structure_pointer(int purpose)
01267 {
01268     return M_WIMS_RET_ST;
01269 }
01270 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01271 int M_wims_return_register(int type, int purpose)
01272 {
01273     switch (type) {
01274         case M_TYPE_INT:        return M_WIMS_RET_I32;
01275         case M_TYPE_LONG:       return M_WIMS_RET_I32;
01276         case M_TYPE_LLONG:      return M_WIMS_RET_I32;
01277         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:      {M_assert(0, "return type cannot be float"); return 0;}
01278         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:     {M_assert(0, "return type cannot be double"); return 0;}
01279         default:                return M_WIMS_RET_I32;
01280     }
01281 }
01282 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01283 /*
01284 char *M_wims_fn_label_name(label)
01285 */
01286 char *M_wims_fn_label_name(char *label, int (*is_func) (char *is_func_label))
01287 {
01288     static char fn_label[1024];
01289 
01290     if ( (*is_func)(label) )  {
01291         sprintf(fn_label,"$fn_%s",label);
01292         return(fn_label);
01293     }
01294     else 
01295         return(label);
01296 }
01297 
01298 char *M_wims_fn_name_from_label(char *label)
01299 {
01300     if ( !strncmp(label,"_$fn",4) )
01301         return(label+4);
01302     else
01303         return(label);
01304 }
01305 
01306 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01307 int M_wims_fragile_macro(int macro_value)
01308 {
01309     switch (M_model)  {
01310         case M_WIMS_16:
01311         case M_WIMS_24:
01312             switch(macro_value)  {
01313                 case L_MAC_SP:
01314                 case L_MAC_FP:
01315                 case L_MAC_LV:          /* added SAM 10-94 */
01316                 case L_MAC_IP:          /* added SAM 10-94 */
01317                 case L_MAC_OP:          /* added SAM 10-94 */
01318                 case L_MAC_LOCAL_SIZE:
01319                 case L_MAC_PARAM_SIZE:
01320                 case L_MAC_SWAP_SIZE:       
01321                                 return 0;       
01322                 default:        return(1);
01323             }
01324         default:
01325             M_assert (0, "M_wims_fragile_macro:  Illegal model specified!");
01326             return (0);
01327     }
01328 }
01329 
01330 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01331 int M_wims_subroutine_call(int opc)
01332 {
01333     switch (M_model)  {
01334         case M_WIMS_16:
01335         case M_WIMS_24:
01336             return ((opc==Lop_JSR) || (opc==Lop_JSR_FS) ||
01337                     (opc==Lop_MUL) || (opc==Lop_MUL_U) ||
01338                     (opc==Lop_DIV) || (opc==Lop_DIV_U) ||
01339                     (opc==Lop_REM) || (opc==Lop_REM_U));
01340         default:
01341             M_assert (0, "M_wims_subroutine_call:  Illegal model specified!");
01342             return (0);
01343     }
01344 }
01345 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01346 /*
01347  * Declare code generator specific macro registers to the front end parser.
01348  */
01349 void M_define_macros_wims(STRING_Symbol_Table *sym_tbl)
01350 {
01351     M_add_symbol(sym_tbl, "$true_sp", WIMS_MAC_TRUE_SP);
01352     /* 1 if leaf function, 0 if non-leaf */
01353     M_add_symbol(sym_tbl, "$leaf", WIMS_MAC_LEAF);
01354     /* total alloc requirements */
01355     M_add_symbol(sym_tbl, "$alloc_size", WIMS_MAC_ALLOC);
01356     /* number of integer and float callee saved registers used */
01357     M_add_symbol(sym_tbl, "$callee_i_regs", WIMS_MAC_CALLEE_I);
01358     M_add_symbol(sym_tbl, "gr2", WIMS_MAC_RETADDR);
01359   
01360 }
01361 
01362 char *M_get_macro_name_wims(int id)
01363 {
01364     switch (id) {
01365         case WIMS_MAC_LEAF:              return "$leaf";
01366         case WIMS_MAC_ALLOC:             return "$alloc_size";
01367         case WIMS_MAC_CALLEE_I:          return "$callee_i_regs";
01368         case WIMS_MAC_TRUE_SP:           return "$true_sp";
01369         case WIMS_MAC_RETADDR:           return "gr2";
01370 
01371         default:                       
01372                                       return "?";
01373     }
01374 }

01377 {
01378 }
01379 
01380 char *M_get_opcode_name_wims(int id)
01381 {
01382     switch(id)  {
01383         default:                        return ("?");
01384     }
01385 }
01386 
01387 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01388 /*
01389  * Return true (1) if the instruction is supported in the hardware of the
01390  * processor.  Return false (0) otherwise.
01391  */
01392 int M_oper_supported_in_arch_wims(int opc)
01393 {
01394     switch(opc) {
01395 
01396         case Lop_NOR:
01397         case Lop_NAND:
01398         case Lop_NXOR:
01399         case Lop_OR_NOT:
01400 
01401         case Lop_EXTRACT:
01402         case Lop_EXTRACT_U:
01403         case Lop_DEPOSIT:
01404 
01405         case Lop_MUL_ADD:
01406         case Lop_MUL_ADD_U:
01407         case Lop_MUL_SUB:
01408         case Lop_MUL_SUB_U:
01409         case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV:
01410         case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_U:
01411         case Lop_MUL_SUB_F:
01412         case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F:
01413         case Lop_MUL_SUB_F2:
01414         case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F2:
01415             return(0);
01416             
01417         case Lop_MUL_ADD_F:
01418         case Lop_MUL_ADD_F2:
01419                 return(0);
01420             
01421         default:        
01422             return(1);
01423     }
01424 }
01425 /*
01426  * Returns the number of machine instructions required to implement the
01427  * specified oper in the best case.  It is assumed that this is for
01428  * supported instructions.  A call to M_oper_supported_in_arch should be
01429  * made for abnormal instructions.
01430  */
01431 
01432 int M_num_oper_required_for_wims(L_Oper *oper, char *name)
01433 {
01434 #define has_label_operand(a)    ((a->src[0]->type == L_OPERAND_LABEL)||\
01435                                  (a->src[1]->type == L_OPERAND_LABEL))
01436 
01437 #define indexed_memory_op(a)    ((a->src[0]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER)&&\
01438                                  (a->src[1]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER))
01439    
01440 #define non_zero_offset(a)      ((!((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01441                                    ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)))||\
01442                                  (a->src[1]->value.i != 0))
01443     
01444 #define short_int_inc(a,b)      ((a->src[b]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01445                                  ((a->src[b]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)&&\
01446                                  (a->src[b]->value.i >= -0x10) &&\
01447                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0x10))
01448 #define long_pos_int_inc(a,b)   ((a->src[b]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01449                                  ((a->src[b]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)&&\
01450                                  (a->src[b]->value.i > 0) && \
01451                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0x2000))
01452 #define long_neg_int_inc(a,b)   ((a->src[b]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01453                                  ((a->src[b]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)&&\
01454                                  (a->src[b]->value.i >= -0x2000) && \
01455                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0))
01456 #define register_inc(a,b)        (a->src[b]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER)
01457 
01458     switch (oper->opc)  {
01459         case Lop_ST_C:  
01460         case Lop_ST_C2:
01461         case Lop_ST_I:
01462             if ( indexed_memory_op(oper) || has_label_operand(oper) )
01463                 return(2);
01464             else
01465                 return(1);
01466             
01467         case Lop_LD_UC: 
01468         case Lop_LD_C: 
01469         case Lop_LD_UC2: 
01470         case Lop_LD_C2: 
01471         case Lop_LD_I: 
01472             if (has_label_operand(oper))
01473                 return (2);
01474             else
01475                 return(1);
01476                 
01477         case Lop_ST_F: 
01478         case Lop_ST_F2: 
01479             if (has_label_operand(oper))
01480                 return (2);
01481             else
01482                 return(1);
01483 
01484         case Lop_LD_F: 
01485         case Lop_LD_F2:
01486             if (has_label_operand(oper))
01487                 return (2);
01488             else
01489                 return(1);
01490             
01491         case Lop_LD_PRE_UC:  
01492         case Lop_LD_PRE_C: 
01493         case Lop_LD_PRE_UC2: 
01494         case Lop_LD_PRE_C2: 
01495         case Lop_LD_PRE_I:
01496             if ( indexed_memory_op(oper) || non_zero_offset(oper) )
01497                 return(2);
01498             else if ( short_int_inc(oper,2) ||
01499                       long_neg_int_inc(oper,2) )
01500                 return(1);
01501             else 
01502                 return(2);
01503             
01504         case Lop_ST_PRE_C: 
01505         case Lop_ST_PRE_C2: 
01506         case Lop_ST_PRE_I: 
01507             if ( indexed_memory_op(oper) || non_zero_offset(oper) )
01508                 return(2);
01509             else if ( short_int_inc(oper,3) ||
01510                       long_neg_int_inc(oper,3) )
01511                 return(1);
01512             else 
01513                 return(2);
01514             
01515         case Lop_LD_POST_UC: 
01516         case Lop_LD_POST_C: 
01517         case Lop_LD_POST_UC2: 
01518         case Lop_LD_POST_C2: 
01519         case Lop_LD_POST_I:
01520             if ( non_zero_offset(oper) )
01521                 return(2);
01522             else if ( short_int_inc(oper,2) ||
01523                       long_pos_int_inc(oper,2) ||
01524                       register_inc(oper,2) )
01525                 return(1);
01526             else
01527                 return(2);
01528             
01529         case Lop_ST_POST_C: 
01530         case Lop_ST_POST_C2: 
01531         case Lop_ST_POST_I:  
01532             if ( indexed_memory_op(oper) || non_zero_offset(oper) )
01533                 return(2);
01534             else if ( short_int_inc(oper,3) ||
01535                       long_pos_int_inc(oper,3) )
01536                 return(1);
01537             else
01538                 return(2);
01539             
01540         case Lop_LD_PRE_F: 
01541         case Lop_LD_PRE_F2:
01542             if ( indexed_memory_op(oper) || non_zero_offset(oper) )
01543                 return(2);
01544             else if ( short_int_inc(oper,2) )
01545                 return(1);
01546             else 
01547                 return(2);
01548             
01549         case Lop_ST_PRE_F: 
01550         case Lop_ST_PRE_F2:
01551             if ( indexed_memory_op(oper) || non_zero_offset(oper) )
01552                 return(2);
01553             else if ( short_int_inc(oper,3) )
01554                 return(1);
01555             else 
01556                 return(2);
01557             
01558         case Lop_LD_POST_F: 
01559         case Lop_LD_POST_F2:  
01560             if ( non_zero_offset(oper) )
01561                 return(2);
01562             else if ( short_int_inc(oper,2) ||
01563                       register_inc(oper,2) )
01564                 return(1);
01565             else
01566                 return(2);
01567         case Lop_ST_POST_F: 
01568         case Lop_ST_POST_F2:
01569             if ( non_zero_offset(oper) )
01570                 return(2);
01571             else if ( short_int_inc(oper,3) ||
01572                       register_inc(oper,3) )
01573                 return(1);
01574             else
01575                 return(2);
01576 
01577         case Lop_PREF_LD:
01578             if (has_label_operand(oper))
01579                 return (2);
01580             else
01581                 return(1);
01582 
01583         default:
01584             return(1);
01585     }
01586 }
01587 
01588 int M_is_stack_operand_wims(L_Operand *operand)
01589 {
01590     if (L_is_macro(operand) &&
01591          ( operand->value.mac == L_MAC_SP ||
01592            operand->value.mac == L_MAC_FP ||
01593            operand->value.mac == WIMS_MAC_TRUE_SP ||
01594            operand->value.mac == L_MAC_SAFE_MEM ||
01595            operand->value.mac == L_MAC_P12 ||
01596            operand->value.mac == L_MAC_IP ||
01597            operand->value.mac == L_MAC_OP ||
01598            operand->value.mac == L_MAC_RS ||
01599            operand->value.mac == L_MAC_LV ) )
01600         return(1);
01601     
01602     return(0);
01603 }
01604 
01605 int M_is_unsafe_macro_wims(L_Operand *operand)
01606 {
01607     if (!L_is_macro(operand))
01608         return(0);
01609     
01610     switch (operand->value.mac)  {
01611         case L_MAC_FP:
01612         case L_MAC_LV:
01613         case L_MAC_IP:
01614         case L_MAC_OP:
01615         case L_MAC_LOCAL_SIZE:
01616         case L_MAC_PARAM_SIZE:
01617         case L_MAC_SWAP_SIZE:
01618                 return 1;
01619         default:                
01620                 return 0;
01621     }
01622 }
01623 
01624 int M_operand_type_wims(L_Operand *operand)
01625 {
01626     /* If NULL operand pointer, then return MDES_OPERAND_NULL */
01627     if (operand == NULL)
01628         return(MDES_OPERAND_NULL);
01629 
01630     switch (L_operand_case_type(operand))  {
01631         case L_OPERAND_INT:
01632             if ( FIELD_5(operand->value.i) )
01633                 return(MDES_OPERAND_Lit5);
01634             else if ( FIELD_11(operand->value.i) )
01635                 return(MDES_OPERAND_Lit11);
01636             else if ( FIELD_14(operand->value.i) )
01637                 return(MDES_OPERAND_Lit14);
01638             else
01639                 return(MDES_OPERAND_Lit21);
01640 
01641         case L_OPERAND_MACRO:
01642         case L_OPERAND_REGISTER:
01643             return(MDES_OPERAND_REG);
01644 
01645         case L_OPERAND_CB:
01646         case L_OPERAND_LABEL:
01647         case L_OPERAND_FLOAT:
01648         case L_OPERAND_DOUBLE:
01649         case L_OPERAND_STRING:
01650             return(MDES_OPERAND_Label);
01651 
01652         default:
01653             M_assert(0,"M_operand_type_wims: Unknown type");
01654             return (0);
01655     }
01656 }
01657 
01658 int M_conflicting_operands_wims(L_Operand *operand, L_Operand **conflict_array, int len, int prepass)
01659 {
01660     int right=0, left=0;
01661 
01662     if ( prepass && (!L_is_macro(operand)) ) {
01663         conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand(operand);
01664         return(1);
01665     }
01666     if (L_is_macro(operand)) {
01667         switch (operand->value.mac)  {
01668             case L_MAC_SP:
01669             case WIMS_MAC_TRUE_SP:
01670             case L_MAC_SAFE_MEM:
01671               conflict_array[0] = L_new_macro_operand(L_MAC_SP, L_CTYPE_INT, L_PTYPE_NULL);
01672               conflict_array[1] = L_new_macro_operand(WIMS_MAC_TRUE_SP, L_CTYPE_INT, L_PTYPE_NULL);
01673               conflict_array[2] = L_new_macro_operand(L_MAC_SAFE_MEM, L_CTYPE_INT, L_PTYPE_NULL);
01674               return(3);
01675             default:
01676               conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand(operand);
01677               return(1);
01678         }
01679     }       
01680     else if (L_is_reg(operand)) {
01681         conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand(operand);
01682         return(1);
01683     }
01684     else
01685         M_assert(0,"Lwims_conflicting_operands: unsupported operand type");
01686     
01687     if (L_is_ctype_dbl(operand)) {
01688       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01689       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand(operand);
01690       conflict_array[0]->value.r = left;
01691       
01692       /* Set up conflicting float register */
01693       conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand(operand);
01694       conflict_array[1]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01695       conflict_array[1]->value.r = left;
01696       
01697       conflict_array[2] = L_copy_operand(operand);
01698       conflict_array[2]->ctype = L_CTYPE_FLOAT;
01699       conflict_array[2]->value.r = right;
01700       return(3);
01701     }
01702     else if (L_is_ctype_flt(operand)) {
01703       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01704       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand(operand);
01705       conflict_array[0]->ctype = L_CTYPE_DOUBLE;
01706       conflict_array[0]->value.r = left;
01707       
01708       /* Set up conflicting double register */
01709       conflict_array[1] = L_copy_operand(operand);
01710       return(2);
01711     }
01712     else {
01713       M_assert(0,"Lwims_conflicting_operands: unsupported operand type");
01714       return (0);
01715     }
01716 }
01717 
01718 int M_num_registers_wims(int ctype)
01719 {
01720   if ((M_model==M_WIMS_16) || (M_model==M_WIMS_24)) {
01721     /* Dont know if these numbers are correct, just guesses.. */
01722     switch (ctype) {
01723       case L_CTYPE_INT:
01724         return (64);    /* over estimate here a bit */
01725       case L_CTYPE_FLOAT:
01726         M_assert(0, "M_num_registers_wims: WIMS does not support float data type");
01727         return (64);
01728       case L_CTYPE_DOUBLE:
01729         M_assert(0, "M_num_registers_wims: WIMS does not support double data type");
01730         return (32);
01731       default:
01732         return (0);
01733     }
01734   } else {
01735     M_assert(0, "M_num_registers_wims: unsupported model");
01736   }
01737   return (0);
01738 }
01739 
01740 int
01741 M_wims_layout_retvar (M_Param param, int purpose)
01742 {
01743   if (param->mtype.type & (M_TYPE_STRUCT | M_TYPE_UNION))
01744     param->mode = M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY;
01745   else
01746     param->mode = M_THRU_MEMORY;
01747   return (param->mode == M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY);
01748 }
